main event: A military pilot spotted an unidentified flying object over South Laos in 1966.
interesting points: The object was first observed at a relative bearing of 120-130 degrees from the pilot's aircraft, at an elevation of 45 degrees.
The object passed over the pilot's aircraft on a northeasterly course and faded from sight in about 2-3 seconds, as if it was burning out.
The object was estimated to be at an altitude of around 16,000 feet above the pilot's aircraft, and it left behind a very bright green tail or exhaust.
The pilot stated that his first impression was that it was a big comet, but it appeared to be under intelligent control.
Another pilot had reported seeing a similar object in the same area on previous occasions.
